intro: Verbesina tovarii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Verbesina tovarii is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
